Diagnosis
	1. Perihilar cholangiocarcinoma, stage IIIB (T4N1M0)
		Date of diagnosis
		January 2024

		Treatment aim
		Curative intent

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Diagnostic laparoscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	1. Gemcitabine/Cisplatin commenced 01 Feb 2024
	2. Cycle 4 completed 15 Apr 2024

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Partial response to treatment

	Current issues
	Grade 2 peripheral neuropathy
	Mild fatigue

	Summary of consultation
	Reviewed today prior to cycle 5 chemotherapy. Latest CT performed on 10/04/24 shows encouraging 40% reduction in size of perihilar mass from 6.8cm to 4.1cm, with reduced biliary obstruction. Portal vein involvement appears stable. Liver function tests have normalized. Performance status remains 1. Main side effect is grade 2 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingers and toes, managed with gabapentin 300mg TDS. Mild fatigue but maintaining daily activities. Weight stable at 72kg.

	Further investigations
	Repeat CT chest/abdomen/pelvis after cycle 6
	Liver function tests weekly

	Medication prescribed
	Gabapentin dose increased to 400mg TDS

	Follow up
	Next oncology follow up in 3 weeks pre cycle 6
MDT discussion planned after completion of cycle 6

	Required GP actions
	Weekly blood tests including FBC, U&Es, LFTs
Monitor neuropathy symptoms
